commit.title: Compare bytes and require http server to fix tests
Increase sleep time slightly to fix Travis CI tests
only show connection string on NoServersAvailable
apply global timeout to connection management
add more ruby versions to travis.ci
Update README with Travis CI information
(optionally) Cache connections to amortize connect() costs.
Use Server as a proxy between the underlying Thrift transport and the thrift client.
Push Connection into ThriftHelpers to prevent namespace pollution.
Push AbstractThriftClient::Server into its own module.
Mark servers down after connect()-related errors.
Added a unit test for multiple callbacks of the same type.
Added support for :before_method and :on_exception callback types. Added support for registering multiple callbacks of a given type.
Updated thrift gem dependency to 0.7.0, bumped thrift_client version to 0.7.0
rename exception_classes_without_disconnect to exception_class_overrides for clarity
Added exception_classes_without_disconnect to handle Thrift::Exceptions that do not require a disconnect and reconnect
Add a method `add_callback` allowing a client to register a block that
set transport timeout after connection is established
Add support for specifying client-side timeouts when using FramedTransport
No need to require rubygems or specify the gem version for thrift
Regenerate gemspec from via rake task
Expose a discrete timeout for connect(2).
depend on thrift v0.5.0, regen test greeter interface
make test_helper require more forgiving of current path
only mark the current server down if we have a current server
get more specific about thrift version
fix a test that would transiently fail
stop doing free retries on connect
move fix the server_retry_period to work the way you expect it to work
get rid of randomize_server_list and always randomize
add Server class for keeping state about a server
add a few TODOs around blanket rescues
update rakefile and gemspec to reflect 0.4.6
improve docs around connection handling and timeouts
Track rename from @socket to @port in tests.
Add oneway method and associated tests.
really fix retries and add test coverage
default retries to 0. fix retry logic so retry means retry
Handle oneway thrift methods by pulling methods in based on send_, and make timeout overrides work.
fixing up require path conflicts with other gems
handle_exception should not be called twice
corrected documentation for transport and transport_wrapper in ThriftClient
fix i16, i32, and i64 read to be signed.
Fix two issues with EventMachine connection
making the RetryingThriftClient#has_timeouts? checks more clear
moving out AbstractThriftClient and the default mixins
moving rdoc to the default ThriftClient initialize
* Handling errors in the handled_proxy method.
tests that test with all working servers.
move private statement up above proxy, note the disconnect! DI break
breaking out the timeout override and transport checks
removing @set_timeout and making has_timeouts! slightly more explicit.
Moving timeout code to its own module called TimingOutThriftClient.
Moving connection retry logic to a module.
Get rid of un used error hash for connection factory
fixing connection fall-through for http clients
move some of the error handling back up to ThriftClient from the Connection objectss
upper bound not needed for timeout tests
add contributing section to the README
move readme so that github will render correctly
Revert "0.3.3 to allow for timeouts over all requests in a call"
Add support for EventMachine transport.  The necessary options changes
fork instead of using green threads
bundle a minimal thrift server with tests to avoid scribe dependency
reverting to take a different approach than mocking
refactor tests to use mocks to avoid having to run a Scribe server
0.3.3 to allow for timeouts over all requests in a call
Don't eject failed hosts forever. Very subtle bug.
Re-add the live server to the pool, if it was rejected for legitimate reasons.
It's in the request code after all.
Don't turn off strict_read by default; allow override.
brittspace! also, fix a bug i noticed in flocker.
Port tests to test/unit; clean up constant handling.
initial commit of simple_thrift with some specs.
Configurable exception classes; validation; port per host.

execute a user-specified block when creating a new client for retry

stop using net:http
code is hard to understand
client uses the same server forever as long as it is successful
client brings all bad servers back into the pool at the same time

client retries on timeouts, making the effective timeout = retries * timeout
don't default to trying all servers

pulls.title: Fix handling of user defined exceptions when retries are enabled
Fix a bug causing reachable servers to be marked as 'Unavailable'
Update README with Travis CI information
Reduce object churn and ensure socket alignment
Remove unnecessary HTTP GET from ThriftHelpers::Connection::HTTP
Updated thrift gem dependency to ">= 0.7.0, < 0.9.0" to allow for thrift-0.8.x compatibility.
Added support for :before_method and :on_exception callback types. Added support for registering multiple callbacks of a given type.
Added support for :before_method and :on_exception callback types. Added support for registering multiple callbacks of a given type.
Updated thrift gem dependency to 0.7.0, bumped thrift_client version to 0.7.0
Add support for specifying client-side timeouts when using FramedTransport
No need to require rubygems or specify the gem version for thrift
